abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission said it would appeal a federal judge’s decision to reject a settlement with Citigroup over securities fraud charges related to the financial crisis.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission said it would appeal a federal judge’s decision to reject a settlement with Citigroup over securities fraud charges related to the financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Securities and Exchange Commission said on Thursday that it would appeal a federal court decision that harshly rejected a settlement between the commission and Citigroup over securities fraud charges related to the financial crisis.

headline.main: Citing ‘Legal Error,’ S.E.C. Says It Will Appeal Rejection of Citigroup Settlement
headline.print_headline: Citing ‘Legal Error,’ S.E.C. Says It Will Appeal Rejection of Citigroup Settlement
